newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Alliance buys Coty's S.African business.
newsitem.headline: Alliance buys Coty's S.African business.

text.p: Alliance Pharmaceuticals Ltd said on Friday it had acquired cosmetic company Coty's southern African business for an undisclosed sum.
The announcement follows a cautionary issued by the company on June 1.
Alliance said in a statement that with effect from July 1, Alliance had the rights to manufacture, market and sell Coty products.
The licence was awarded to the company by Benckiser South Africa, the local office of Coty parent company Joh. Benckiser GmbH.

Alliance had set up Cosmetic Alliance (Pty) Ltd as a wholly-owned subsidiary to conduct the Coty business. In terms of the agreement, Benckiser's Coty business had an option to acquire 49.9 percent of the Cosmetic Alliance in two years' time.

The company said that had the acquisition been effective from March 1 1996, earnings would have increased by one cent per share to 11.4 cents. The effect on net asset value would have been negligible, it added.
